fixes.name: Date Filter Limit Fix
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR UseCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR EndDate = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As])
RETURN
IF(
    UseCustom,
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Max Date Exclude] = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE],
        1,
        0
    ),
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE] = EndDate,
        1,
        0
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF logic to DAX using SELECTEDVALUE for parameters and explicit table-qualified column references. Parameter references [Use Custom Date] and [End Date] were replaced with SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As]) and SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As]) respectively. All column and calculated field references were transformed to 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[ColumnName] format.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references a parameter, and all parameter-based calculations must be measures.
